comment._content: Looks to me like this was taken from my old school, Portora?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/56105315@N07] I think so, from the angle.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 66340104@N05
comment._content:
Walter was a real gentleman. 

Yep, that is taken from Portora and there in the lower foreground is the open air swimming pool, scene of manys a freezing cold swimming experience.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/66340104@N05] Thanks for all your notes on the photo - have added them into our tags. Did you know Walter Brady then? I didn't know he had died... Here are all of Walter's photos (not yet digitised) that we have from the Lawrence Photographic Project 1990/1991
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 66340104@N05
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] I went to school with his son, David. So I did not really know him that well, just as a really friendly Dad of my friend. 

I remember seeing some of his photos years ago and would be keen to see more. As far as I recall he was a great man for the slides and had hundreds, if not thousands.
